topic.title: Can I save my zeroID and use in another instance?
topic.body: Asking if I can save my zeroID and use in another instance...

1_1PRsmkcDcCnKbCfFTeQizKYcDpNn98iQcT.body: 私は日本語を勉強しています！

1_1C6JtzttTcB1nd8Q8JZYDHriciPz3kvLqV.body:
> [nofish](#comment_380_1J3rJ8ecnwH2EPYa6MrgZttBNc61ACFiCj): your identity is stored in data/users.json file all you need to do is copy it to an another instance if you want to use it there.

Thank you. I created a Docker instance so I felt the need to save my ID. May should they make the data volume as a volume in the Docker Image.

3_15EnNiQcFsavvvm7WHt7SCjCv4vV6Gyu7z.body:
> [drapslaget](#comment_2_15EnNiQcFsavvvm7WHt7SCjCv4vV6Gyu7z): Thanks, any idea on how to do that in an already started docker container?

I did running `docker exec -i zeronet_docker_name_here /bin/bash`
and `tail -n 100 /root/data/users.json`
so copied manualy...

> [garou](#comment_3_1C6JtzttTcB1nd8Q8JZYDHriciPz3kvLqV): I did running docker exec -i zeronet_docker_name_here /bin/bashand tail -n 100 /root/data/users.jsonso copied manualy...

yeah... In the end you can just run `docker exec  zeronet_docker_name_here tail -n 100 /root/data/users.json`...
